text.description:
ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹ Best Italian Food in Milan: https://youtu.be/De0IIm3XXMw ðŸ‘• T-shirts: https://store.migrationology.com/ ðŸŒ¶ Ghost Chili: https://amzn.to/3PNTvNQ
FLORENCE, ITALY - Today weâ€™re going on an ultimate Italian food tour in Florence, Italy. Weâ€™ll eat some of the most legendary street food, iconic dishes, and then end with a truly authentic and rare Florentine meal for dinner. Get ready to eat your way through Florence!
Friends in the video: Edoardo Celadon (@MostOfItaly https://www.mostofitaly.com/) - Edoardo can arrange you the best and most authentic food experiences throughout Italy! Jeffrey Merrihue: https://www.instagram.com/xtremefoodies_/ Hamid Sepidnam: https://www.instagram.com/mr.taster/
Hereâ€™s all the Italian food we ate in Florence:
Allâ€™Antico Vinaio, Florence, Italy (https://maps.app.goo.gl/DYuKWMcZYo2a9ih78) - Weâ€™re starting off this Italian street food tour with what is easily one of the worldâ€™s most famous sandwiches from Allâ€™Antico Vinaio. Their bread is immaculate, right out of the oven. I tried three different sandwiches, all of which were outstanding: Sandwich 1: Favolosa - Sbriciolona salami, cream of pecorino cheese, artichokes, spicy eggplants Sandwich 2: La Inferno - Roast suckling pig, spicy cream, spicy eggplant, rocket Sandwich 3: La Paradiso - Mortadella, stracciatella cheese, pistachios
Tripperia Pollini Lampredotto - You can visit Florence without trying their beloved lampredetto, a sandwich made with the cowâ€™s 4th stomach (abomasum). Traditionally itâ€™s just served with salt and pepper, but with some herb oil and chili oil it really bumps up the flavor.
Vivoli Gelato - Continuing with this Italian food tour with had a Gran Crema CaffÃ¨ Vivoli (Affogato) - Cream gelato with coffee, at one of the original and historical gelato shops - it was delicious!
Tripe sandwich: Da' Vinattieri - Edoardo next brought us into an alley to eat Trippa alla Fiorentina - Florence style tripe sandwich, which is slightly different from the lampredetto we had already eaten earlier.
La Sorbettiera - After trying the original and old style gelato affogato, we then needed to try a modern gelato spot.
CibrÃ¨o Ristorante, Florence, Italy (https://maps.app.goo.gl/riMyoyB2x3RbrS5EA) - Finally, along with all the street food, we decided to sit down for a massive higher end dinner to highlight some of the true and nearly forgotten Italian dishes of Florence. We tried the massive Antipasto, Collo di pollo ripieno - stuffed chicken neck, Tagliolini cacio e burro - pasta with cheese and butter, Roastbeef del CibrÃ¨o CaffÃ¨ - roast beef with butter sauce, and finally CibrÃ¨o - chicken and rooster organs in egg and lemon sauce! What a meal, highly recommended and thank you again for Edoardo for arranging it.
Thank you again to Edoardo Celadon (@MostOfItaly https://www.mostofitaly.com/) for arranging this incredible day of food in Florence! He can arrange authentic Italian food tours throughout Italy.
Social Media: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/markwiensfoodvideos Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/migrationology/ Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@markwiens
ðŸ‘• T-shirts: https://store.migrationology.com/ ðŸŒ¶ Ghost Chili: https://amzn.to/3PNTvNQ ðŸŽ¥ Camera gear I use: https://amzn.to/3FVdBUd (some of these are Amazon affiliate links)
